summary.long: Titus is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ to further the faith of God’s elect and their knowledge of the truth that leads to godliness –
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the hope of eternal life, which God, who does not lie, promised before the beginning of time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and which now at his appointed season he has brought to light through the preaching entrusted to me by the command of God our Saviour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To Titus, my true son in our common faith:
Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An elder must be blameless, faithful to his wife, a man whose children believe and are not open to the charge of being wild and disobedient.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since an overseer manages God’s household, he must be blameless – not overbearing, not quick-tempered, not given to drunkenness, not violent, not pursuing dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rather, he must be hospitable, one who loves what is good, who is self-controlled, upright, holy and disciplined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He must hold firmly to the trustworthy message as it has been taught, so that he can encourage others by sound doctrine and refute those who oppose it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are many rebellious people, full of meaningless talk and deception, especially those of the circumcision group.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They must be silenced, because they are disrupting whole households by teaching things they ought not to teach – and that for the sake of dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of Crete’s own prophets has said it: ‘Cretans are always liars, evil brutes, lazy gluttons.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This saying is true. Therefore rebuke them sharply, so that they will be sound in the faith
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will pay no attention to Jewish myths or to the merely human commands of those who reject the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the pure, all things are pure, but to those who are corrupted and do not believe, nothing is pure. In fact, both their minds and consciences are corrupted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They claim to know God, but by their actions they deny him. They are detestable, disobedient and unfit for doing anything good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You, however, must teach what is appropriate to sound doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach the older men to be temperate, worthy of respect, self-controlled, and sound in faith, in love and in endurance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, teach the older women to be reverent in the way they live, not to be slanderers or addicted to much wine, but to teach what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they can urge the younger women to love their husbands and children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be self-controlled and pure, to be busy at home, to be kind, and to be subject to their husbands, so that no one will malign the word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Similarly, encourage the young men to be self-controlled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In everything set them an example by doing what is good. In your teaching show integrity, seriousness
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Teach slaves to be subject to their masters in everything, to try to please them, not to talk back to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not to steal from them, but to show that they can be fully trusted, so that in every way they will make the teaching about God our Saviour attractive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the grace of God has appeared that offers salvation to all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It teaches us to say ‘No’ to ungodliness and worldly passions, and to live self-controlled, upright and godly lives in this present age,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while we wait for the blessed hope – the appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour, Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave himself for us to redeem us from all wickedness and to purify for himself a people that are his very own, eager to do what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These, then, are the things you should teach. Encourage and rebuke with all authority. Do not let anyone despise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remind the people to be subject to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready to do whatever is good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to slander no one, to be peaceable and considerate, and always to be gentle towards everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At one time we too were foolish, disobedient, deceived and enslaved by all kinds of passions and pleasures. We lived in malice and envy, being hated and hating one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the kindness and love of God our Saviour appeared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he saved us, not because of righteous things we had done, but because of his mercy. He saved us through the washing of rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom he poured out on us generously through Jesus Christ our Saviour,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that, having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs having the hope of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a trustworthy saying. And I want you to stress these things, so that those who have trusted in God may be careful to devote themselves to doing what is good. These things are excellent and profitable for everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and arguments and quarrels about the law, because these are unprofitable and useless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Warn a divisive person once, and then warn them a second time. After that, have nothing to do with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You may be sure that such people are warped and sinful; they are self-condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, because I have decided to winter there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do everything you can to help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way and see that they have everything they need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our people must learn to devote themselves to doing what is good, in order to provide for urgent needs and not live unproductive lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone with me sends you greetings. Greet those who love us in the faith.
Grace be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
